pages.title: Radiator
pages.text: The <item>Radiator/$ is a way of producing heat using <thing>$(l:crossroads:fluid/steam)steam/$. <thing>$(l:crossroads:fluid/steam)Steam/$ can be input and <thing>distilled water/$ can be output on the top and bottom, and <item>$(l:crossroads:heat/cable)cables/$ connect to the sides.$(br2)<thing>Distilled water/$ is produced in equal quantity of <thing>$(l:crossroads:fluid/steam)steam/$ consumed. The <thing>radiator/$ has no maximum temperature.

The because <thing>$(l:crossroads:fluid/steam)steam/$ is usually made <em>using/$ <thing>heat/$ in the same ratio as the <item>radiator/$ produces, the <item>radiator/$ is mainly useful for moving heat long distances, or for increasing the maximum reachable temperature- as <thing>$(l:crossroads:fluid/steam)steam/$ can be produced at as cold as 100Â°C, while the <item>radiator/$ has no maximum temperature.$(br2)
